title: Finding the Vertex: Standard Form Method

content.problem: Find the vertex of the quadratic function f(x) = 3x² - 12x + 8.
steps:
Step 1: Identify the values of a, b, and c
a = 3, b = -12, c = 8

Step 2: Calculate the x-coordinate of the vertex using x = -b/(2a)
x = -(-12)/(2(3)) = 12/6 = 2

Step 3: Find the y-coordinate by substituting the x-value into the original function
f(2) = 3(2)² - 12(2) + 8
f(2) = 3(4) - 24 + 8
f(2) = 12 - 24 + 8
f(2) = -4

Step 4: Write the vertex as an ordered pair
Vertex = (2, -4)
content.explanation: The vertex formula x = -b/(2a) works for any quadratic function in standard form. Since a > 0 in this example, the vertex is a minimum point, meaning f(x) ≥ -4 for all values of x.
